events.message: The insured reported a car accident involving a rear-end collision at a stoplight, requesting to file a claim for the damages.
Claim was categorized as an Auto Accident case based on initial claim details mentioning vehicle collision and damages.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle the case and start communications with the policyholder promptly.
The claim was formally acknowledged and the insured was notified that the process had started to evaluate the damages and coverage.
The insured was asked to submit photos of the car damage, police report, and a copy of the driving license to move ahead with the claim.
Received all requested documents from the insured including detailed pictures of the vehicle damage and the official police report.
The investigation team was engaged to verify details of the collision and check for policy coverage applicability based on submitted documents.
Investigation concluded confirming the insured is at fault for the accident but claim is valid and repair costs are reasonable.
A settlement offer for car repair costs totaling $5,000 was proposed to the insured, awaiting their approval to proceed.
The insured responded positively to the proposed settlement and requested fast processing for the repair payment.
After confirmation from the insured, the claim was officially approved and prepared for payment issuance.
Payment of $5,000 was successfully issued to the insuredâ€™s designated repair shop to cover vehicle repair expenses.
The claim file was closed following full payment issuance and confirmation that the insured vehicle repairs were scheduled.
The closed claim was archived for record purposes and future reference, completing the auto accident claims process.
